# rut - Run Unit Tests

> A modern test runner for Python's unittest framework

- Repository: https://github.com/schettino72/rut
- Full docs: [llms-full.txt](llms-full.txt)

## Overview

`rut` is a drop-in replacement for running unittest tests with modern features:
- Blazingly fast to type (only 3 characters)
- Built-in async support
- Keyword-based test filtering
- Topological test ordering by import dependencies
- Incremental testing (only run affected tests)
- Code coverage support

## Installation

```bash
uv add --dev rut
```

## Quick Start

```bash
rut                      # Run all tests
rut -k "feature"         # Run tests matching keyword
rut --changed            # Run only affected tests
rut -x                   # Stop on first failure
rut -s                   # Show print output
rut --cov                # Run with coverage
```

## Documentation

- [README](https://github.com/schettino72/rut#readme): Full documentation
- [PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/rut/): Package page

## Configuration

Configure via `[tool.rut]` in `pyproject.toml`:

```toml
[tool.rut]
source_dirs = ["src", "tests"]  # Directories to track
test_base_dir = "tests"          # conftest.py location
warning_filters = ["error::UserWarning:pydantic"]
```

## Writing Tests

Use standard `unittest.TestCase` for sync tests and `unittest.IsolatedAsyncioTestCase` for async tests.

## Session Hooks

Define `rut_session_setup()` and `rut_session_teardown()` in `tests/conftest.py` for session-level setup/teardown.
